overview_of_class:
The Hindi-Urdu poetry: The primary goal of this class is for students acquire advanced skills in reading, writing, speaking, and understanding Hindi-Urdu. Throughout the quarter, each reading assignment, class discussion, and evaluative exercise will be primarily focused on this goal.

Students will also become familiar with some of the most significant Hindi-Urdu poets of the twentieth century, and will gain an important introduction into the diverse ways in which poets negotiated through the different forms of poetry - modern social conditions and political events in India such as Partition, caste, purdah (veiling), communalism, feminism, and homosexuality etc.

Throughout the course, emphasis will be placed on both understanding the evolving Hindi-Urdu literary idiom as it has developed over the last several decades and on developing the critical language capability to be able to discuss and write about literature and related socio-political issues in Hindi-Urdu.
name: Hindi-Urdu IV: Topics in Advanced Hindi-Urdu
subject: HIND_URD
